comment: Acts as though he's single. Get tested

Had this for Cloud Computing. He recycled slides from another professor and made the class do a 2 month, maybe longer, amazon web services sales pitch over all the features and tested us on information not relevant to this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Given that virtualization is a new subject to me, Dr. Qolomany presented the information in a way that was easy to understand and he is highly knowledgeable at the same time. I liked the idea for the final project, the hands-on assignments were interesting.

His instructions are never clear. He doesn't use real-world common sense with his programs. His tests are 20% of the gradeand are hard. He gives you little time to complete big assignments and for his labs, he posts them on Fridays, doesn't let anyone know and has them due the following Tuesday. His communication is the worst

He now works at University of Nebraska at Kearney. He expects us to take this general course/100 level class as if it is 400 level. This class is not passable unless you have a strong networking background. For someone who has some background on networking, my ITEC 335 class is much easier to follow. If i could give a 0. I would.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Good professor and nice guy. There can be some communication issues but the class is fair and he isnt the stone cold person some people make him out to be. I wouldnt choose any other prof for Data Structures

Dr. Qolomany is very respectful. He answers questions and I like that he gave the people that needed it, a chance to better their midterm scores. He understands that the content is a lot and spaces it out well and tried to make the content clear and simple despite the complexity of the content.

Dr. Qolomany has good experience in machine learning and big data analytics area. It was worth taking Big data analytics course with Dr. Qolomany. He covers the most cutting edge topics about big data. I believe the course is very useful for job as well as for research.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: professor qolomany definitely knew he was teaching there would just often be miscommunication,he made the class less daunting. He is always punctual and arrived on time to class.

Professor Qolomany is very respectful of his students and also very knowledgeable of the topic. He constantly asks if anyone has questions and I believe he genuinely wants his students to understand. He also makes hw assignments very clear.

The quizzes and tests are unpredictable there is no clear description on what will be on the test and the quiz. It is just a title of topic for the study guide. so good luck figuring that out and there is no bonus or curve that will help so don't expect anything . final is tougher than any tests and content might not even covered in class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Horrible professor. This cloud computing class consisted of students doing presentations on AWS services and him only lecturing a handful of times. When he did he just read from the same slide deck passed around in Networking/Fog computing classes. His tests were overly meticulous, and topics were covered a day before the test, from the slides...

DO NOT TAKE HIM. Explanations are convoluted & make no sense. Draws on the board, then draws over it to further explain, but only ends up making a mess. Gives pop quizzes. Teaches only 8 students in front of him, and ignore everyone else. Gives a study guide for the test but it doesn't help. Messing up that test makes it very difficult to pass.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: NEVER TAKE THIE PROFESSOR. You will learn nothing and not get an easy A. He does not give any lectures but let students give 30-40min presentations. After that, he assigned project presentation again. The text was from students' presentations but was very unclear to study. Is he a professor or an audience? Pls choose better professors KSU.

There are 2 questions in his quizzes and 4 questions in his exams. 1 question will be a random trick question (worth a huge percentage of your grade) that was not covered in the textbook or in class. And you will get NO partial credit for your answer either. This ensures that ALL students will have a decent probability of failing.
